Line 77: Line 77:
===Windows To Go===
===Windows To Go===
â
Windows To Go is an upcoming Windows 8 feature that will allow users to create a bootable USB Flash drive with Windows 8 in it, including the user's programs, settings, and files, effectively making it a [[Live USB]].<ref>http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9220004/Windows_8_will_run_from_USB_thumb_drive?taxonomyId=125</ref><ref>http://www.gmanews.tv/story/232480/technology/windows-8-fits-on-a-thumb-drive</ref><ref>http://news.softpedia.com/news/Windows-8-Running-on-a-USB-Windows-To-Go-221470.shtml</ref><ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/04/15/windows-8-to-feature-usb-runnable-portable-workspaces-sales-of/</ref>. It is reported to work on both USB 2.0 and USB 3.0, and on legacy BIOS and UEFI firmware.<ref>http://techie-buzz.com/microsoft/windows-8-usb-to-go-demo.html</ref> In addition to that, the system will freeze if the USB drive is removed, and will continue to operate if the USB drive is insierted in the next 60 seconds of removal.<ref>http://techie-buzz.com/microsoft/windows-8-usb-to-go-demo.html</ref>
+
Windows To Go is an upcoming Windows 8 feature that will allow users to create a bootable USB Flash drive with Windows 8 in it, including the user's programs, settings, and files, effectively making it a [[Live USB]].<ref>http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9220004/Windows_8_will_run_from_USB_thumb_drive?taxonomyId=125</ref><ref>http://www.gmanews.tv/story/232480/technology/windows-8-fits-on-a-thumb-drive</ref><ref>http://news.softpedia.com/news/Windows-8-Running-on-a-USB-Windows-To-Go-221470.shtml</ref><ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/04/15/windows-8-to-feature-usb-runnable-portable-workspaces-sales-of/</ref>. It is reported to work on both USB 2.0 and USB 3.0, and on legacy BIOS and UEFI firmware.<ref>http://techie-buzz.com/microsoft/windows-8-usb-to-go-demo.html</ref> In addition to that, the system will freeze if the USB drive is removed, and will continue to operate if the USB drive is inserted in the next 60 seconds of removal.<ref>http://techie-buzz.com/microsoft/windows-8-usb-to-go-demo.html</ref>
